title: Winter Fuel Payment update for millions of state pensioners as concerns mount
text:
'What additional steps will be taken to ensure that those that miss out on the 21st December deadline will still be able to get support to keep warm this winter? ' The Government has stood firm on its decision not to backtrack on means-testing the winter fuel payment, despite Labour backbenchers raising concerns about the potential consequences.
Pensions minister Emma Reynolds pointed to the Government's £22bn deficit as the reason behind the tough call, with pensioners having only until Saturday to apply for pension credit to offset the reduction.
Labour's Neil-Duncan Jordan, representing Poole, highlighted in Parliament: "The poorest pensioners in our society are those who are eligible for the pension credit but don't claim it, or just a few pounds above the threshold and they miss out on passported support.
"We won't reconsider that decision because in a very tight fiscal environment when we inherited a £22 billion black hole from the party opposite, we had to take some very tough decisions."
